sentences.english: When they tighten their belts, austerity ripples out and chokes growth.
sentences.chinese: 當他們束緊褲腰帶，簡樸生活會波及到經濟增長。

sentences.english: I get to tighten my belt that month.
sentences.chinese: 這個月我不可不勒緊褲腰帶過生活。

sentences.english: She told the boy to tuck in his shirt.
sentences.chinese: 她叫男孩把襯衣塞進褲腰裏。

sentences.english: The man tucked his letter in.
sentences.chinese: 那個人把信塞進褲腰裏。

sentences.english: On the sides are velcro tab waist adjusters.
sentences.chinese: 在邊上是維可牢褲腰調節扣。

sentences.english: Waistband on the sides in each of a nylon buckle, very strong.
sentences.chinese: 褲腰上左右兩方各有一個尼龍的扣，非常結實。

sentences.english: Our hardest task continues to be persuading men to confront the fact that their waistbands have risen.
sentences.chinese: 我們最難的任務還是告訴男人們，他們的褲腰上升了。

sentences.english: Slip the waistband around the board’s narrow end, with the fly facing the floor.
sentences.chinese: 將褲腰套在熨衣板的窄的那一頭，讓門襟朝下。

sentences.english: He shoved the gun into his waistband and buttoned his jacket over it.
sentences.chinese: 迅速插在褲腰帶上，把上衣拉展，蓋好，扣上鈕子。

definition: richly bedecked/dripping with gold and silver (idiom)
weight/pendant/same as 墜胡|坠胡[zhui4 hu2]/ballad singing accompanied by a 墜胡|坠胡[zhui4 hu2]
collar/neckband/neckline/the place where the two ends of a collar meet
